intro: Scypharia guayaquilensis, commonly known as the Guayaquil scypharia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its botanical features include a slender stem, aromatic foliage, and yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Scypharia guayaquilensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native habitat.
